intro: Pyrostria suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarez's pyrostria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Andes of Ecuador. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cavity. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red and orange. It thrives in high-altitude cloud forests, where it relies on specific microclimatic conditions for survival. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
